intro: Casearia onacaensis, commonly known as the Onacaensis casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
